    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "/api/v2/rundowns", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /api/v2/rundowns

    Example responses

    200 Response

    [{"id":"string","name":"string","createDate":"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","studioName":"string","studioMosId":"string","playDate":"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z"}]

    [
  {
    "id": "string",
    "name": "string",
    "createDate": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
    "studioName": "string",
    "studioMosId": "string",
    "playDate": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z"
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success Inline

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Restrictions Description
    anonymous [RundownResponseModel] false none [Response object for rundown]
    id string false none Rundown's id
    name string false none Rundown's name
    createDate string(date-time) false none Creation datetime
    studioName string false none Studio's name
    studioMosId string false none Studio MOS id
    playDate string(date-time) false none The datetime when first play

    Get all stories by rundown's id

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET /api/v2/rundown('{rundownId}')/stories \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    GET /api/v2/rundown('{rundownId}')/stories HTTP/1.1

Accept: text/plain


    
const headers = {
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/rundown('{rundownId}')/stories',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

result = RestClient.get '/api/v2/rundown('{rundownId}')/stories',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

r = requests.get('/api/v2/rundown('{rundownId}')/stories', headers = headers)

print(r.json())


    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('GET','/api/v2/rundown('{rundownId}')/stories', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/rundown('{rundownId}')/stories");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "/api/v2/rundown('{rundownId}')/stories", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /api/v2/rundown('{rundownId}')/stories

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    rundownId path string true none

    Example responses

    200 Response

    [{"storyTitle":"string","events":[{"eventTitle":"string","materialId":"string","materialTitle":"string","duration":0,"som":0,"eom":0,"version":"string","channel":"string","status":"Idle"}]}]

    [
  {
    "storyTitle": "string",
    "events": [
      {
        "eventTitle": "string",
        "materialId": "string",
        "materialTitle": "string",
        "duration": 0,
        "som": 0,
        "eom": 0,
        "version": "string",
        "channel": "string",
        "status": "Idle"
      }
    ]
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success Inline

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Restrictions Description
    anonymous [StoryResponseModel] false none [Response object for story]
    storyTitle string false none Story title
    events [StoryEventResponseModel] false none Story's events
    eventTitle string false none Event title
    materialId string false none Material's id
    materialTitle string false none Material title
    duration integer(int64) false none Total duration of event
    som integer(int64) false none SOM
    eom integer(int64) false none EOM
    version string false none Version
    channel string false none Channel
    status StoryEventStatus false none Story event status

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    status Idle
    status NextStandby
    status Cueing
    status Standby
    status Play
    status Freeze
    status End
    status Skipped
    status Error
    status Preparing
    status Skip

    Search

    Get all defined searchable fields also including custom fields which are enable full-text search

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET /api/v2/search/searchable-fields \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    GET /api/v2/search/searchable-fields HTTP/1.1

Accept: text/plain


    
const headers = {
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/search/searchable-fields',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

result = RestClient.get '/api/v2/search/searchable-fields',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

r = requests.get('/api/v2/search/searchable-fields', headers = headers)

print(r.json())


    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('GET','/api/v2/search/searchable-fields', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/search/searchable-fields");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "/api/v2/search/searchable-fields", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /api/v2/search/searchable-fields

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {"material":[{"hiveFieldName":"string","fieldName":"string","type":"string","availableValues":{"property1":"string","property2":"string"}}],"folder":[{"hiveFieldName":"string","fieldName":"string","type":"string","availableValues":{"property1":"string","property2":"string"}}],"sequence":[{"hiveFieldName":"string","fieldName":"string","type":"string","availableValues":{"property1":"string","property2":"string"}}],"marker":[{"hiveFieldName":"string","fieldName":"string","type":"string","availableValues":{"property1":"string","property2":"string"}}]}

    {
  "material": [
    {
      "hiveFieldName": "string",
      "fieldName": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "availableValues": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  ],
  "folder": [
    {
      "hiveFieldName": "string",
      "fieldName": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "availableValues": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  ],
  "sequence": [
    {
      "hiveFieldName": "string",
      "fieldName": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "availableValues": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  ],
  "marker": [
    {
      "hiveFieldName": "string",
      "fieldName": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "availableValues": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success SearchableFieldCollectionResponseModel

    Search all resource in Hive by condition

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST /api/v2/search \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json-patch+json' \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    POST /api/v2/search HTTP/1.1

Content-Type: application/json-patch+json
Accept: text/plain


    const inputBody = '{
  "conditions": [
    {
      "field": "string",
      "value": "string",
      "operator": "AND"
    }
  ],
  "repository": "Material"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/search',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept' => 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

result = RestClient.post '/api/v2/search',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept': 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

r = requests.post('/api/v2/search', headers = headers)

print(r.json())


    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('POST','/api/v2/search', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/search");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json-patch+json"},
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "/api/v2/search", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /api/v2/search

    The fulltext search allows to query materials, markers, folders and sequences by condition. Noted that the returned result is not following a fixed data structure which is dynamic according to repository name

    Body parameter

    {
  "conditions": [
    {
      "field": "string",
      "value": "string",
      "operator": "AND"
    }
  ],
  "repository": "Material"
}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    page query integer(int32) false Page index for pagination, default is "1", starts with "1"
    size query integer(int32) false Page size for pagination, default is "10", min value is "1"
    orderby query SortableFields false Sort the results by sortable field, default is CreateTime
    sort query SortBy false Sorts the result in ascending or descending order, default is ASC
    body body FulltextSearchRequestModel true Search request
    conditions body [FieldConditionModel] true Field condition object
    field body string true Field name
    value body string false All types of values should be string format in request payload, even "integer" should be "0", "10"
    operator body BooleanOperators false Boolean operators for fulltext search
    repository body RepositoryNames true Index repository names available for search

    Detailed descriptions

    value: All types of values should be string format in request payload, even "integer" should be "0", "10" Supports range searches: Number range: [* TO 10000] Date range: [2000-01-01 00:00:00 TO 2000-12-31 23:59:59] Supports wildcard matching: Starts with "foo" in field: foo* Starts with "foo" and ends with "bar" in the field: foo*bar

    Enumerated Values

    Parameter Value
    orderby Type
    orderby CreateTime
    orderby Name
    sort DESC
    sort ASC
    operator AND
    operator OR
    operator NOT
    repository Material
    repository Marker
    repository Folder
    repository Sequence

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {"result":[{}],"page":0,"size":0,"totalCount":0,"totalPage":0,"elapsed":0}

    {
  "result": [
    {}
  ],
  "page": 0,
  "size": 0,
  "totalCount": 0,
  "totalPage": 0,
  "elapsed": 0
}

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success ObjectPaginationResponseModel
    400: ValidationFailed Invalid request body None

    Subscription

    Subscribe events

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST /api/v2/subscription \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json-patch+json' \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    POST /api/v2/subscription HTTP/1.1

Content-Type: application/json-patch+json
Accept: text/plain


    const inputBody = '{
  "events": [
    "FolderCreated"
  ],
  "subscriber": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/subscription',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

  'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',

    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

// Define array of request body.

try {
    $response = $client->request('POST','/api/v2/subscription', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/subscription");

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json-patch+json"},
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "/api/v2/subscription", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /api/v2/subscription

    The application for receiving callback notifications should provide a POST endpoint, for example:

    • POST http://www.example.com/receiver: All of subscribed notifications will be sent using POST method
    The subscription also provides Kafka queue for high-performance application, all types of message can be found in the queue "MBH_EVENT_v2"

    Body parameter

    {
  "events": [
    "FolderCreated"
  ],
  "subscriber": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    body body SubscriptionModel true The subscription object
    events body [AvailableEvents] false Subscribe to multiple events
    subscriber body string true A valid URL which can be accessed by Hive

    Enumerated Values

    Parameter Value
    events FolderCreated
    events FolderDeleted
    events FolderUpdated
    events CollectionPoolCreated
    events CollectionPoolDeleted
    events CollectionPoolUpdated
    events MaterialCreated
    events MaterialDeleted
    events MaterialMoved
    events MaterialRestored
    events MaterialPurged
    events MaterialUpdated
    events MediaReady
    events MarkerCreated
    events MarkerDeleted
    events MarkerUpdated
    events ImportStarted
    events ImportFinished
    events ImportFailed
    events ExportStarted
    events ExportFinished
    events ExportFailed

    Example responses

    0 Response

    {"offset":0,"message":{},"event":"string","operator":{"source":"string","time":"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","userId":"string"}}

    {
  "offset": 0,
  "message": {},
  "event": "string",
  "operator": {
    "source": "string",
    "time": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
    "userId": "string"
  }
}

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    0 none NotificationWrapperModel
    200 Success SubscriptionResponseModel
    400: ValidationFailed Invalid request body None

    Test the connection between API gateway and application, connection timeout is 10s

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST /api/v2/subscription/test-connection \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json-patch+json' \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    POST /api/v2/subscription/test-connection HTTP/1.1

Content-Type: application/json-patch+json
Accept: text/plain


    const inputBody = '{
  "subscriber": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/subscription/test-connection',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'

  'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',

    <?php

    'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',

    $response = $client->request('POST','/api/v2/subscription/test-connection', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    response.append(inputLine);

System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json-patch+json"},
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "/api/v2/subscription/test-connection", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /api/v2/subscription/test-connection

    The application for receiving callback notifications should provide a POST endpoint, for example:

    • POST http://www.example.com/receiver: All of subscribed notifications will be sent using POST method

    Body parameter

    {
  "subscriber": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    body body TestSubscriptionModel true The subscription testing object
    subscriber body string true A valid URL which can be accessed by Hive

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {"get":{"elapsedTime":0,"delivered":true,"responseStatus":"string","httpStatusCode":"continue","errorMessage":"string"},"post":{"elapsedTime":0,"delivered":true,"responseStatus":"string","httpStatusCode":"continue","errorMessage":"string"}}

    {
  "get": {
    "elapsedTime": 0,
    "delivered": true,
    "responseStatus": "string",
    "httpStatusCode": "continue",
    "errorMessage": "string"
  },
  "post": {
    "elapsedTime": 0,
    "delivered": true,
    "responseStatus": "string",
    "httpStatusCode": "continue",
    "errorMessage": "string"
  }
}

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success TestConnectionResponseModel
    400: ValidationFailed Invalid request body None

    Unsubscribe event

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget

  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    DELETE /api/v2/subscription/{subscriberId} HTTP/1.1

  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/subscription/{subscriberId}',
{
  method: 'DELETE',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'

    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

// Define array of request body.

    $response = $client->request('DELETE','/api/v2/subscription/{subscriberId}', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("DELETE", "/api/v2/subscription/{subscriberId}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /api/v2/subscription/{subscriberId}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    subscriberId path string true Subscriber's id

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success None

    System

    Get defined system permissions

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET /api/v2/system/permissions \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    GET /api/v2/system/permissions HTTP/1.1

Accept: text/plain


    
const headers = {
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/system/permissions',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

result = RestClient.get '/api/v2/system/permissions',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

r = requests.get('/api/v2/system/permissions', headers = headers)

print(r.json())


    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('GET','/api/v2/system/permissions', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/permissions");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "/api/v2/system/permissions", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /api/v2/system/permissions

    Example responses

    200 Response

    [{"key":"string","description":"string"}]

    [
  {
    "key": "string",
    "description": "string"
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success Inline

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Restrictions Description
    anonymous [PermissionResponseModel] false none [Response object for permission]
    key string false none Permission key
    description string false none Permission description

    Get user basic information by ID

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET /api/v2/system/user('{userId}') \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    GET /api/v2/system/user('{userId}') HTTP/1.1

Accept: text/plain


    
const headers = {
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

result = RestClient.get '/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

r = requests.get('/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')', headers = headers)

print(r.json())


    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('GET','/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /api/v2/system/user('{userId}')

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    userId path string true User's ID

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {"id":"string","avatarUrl":"string","email":"string","loginName":"string","showName":"string","phoneNumber":"string","groups":[{"code":"string","name":"string"}],"roles":[{"code":"string","name":"string","fromGroup":{"groupCode":"string","groupName":"string"}}],"permissions":["string"],"storages":[{"poolCode":"string","description":"string","dependsOnGroup":{},"dependsOnRole":{},"units":[{"unitCode":"string","label":["string"],"files":0,"size":0,"used":0,"roots":{"property1":"string","property2":"string"}}]}],"createTime":"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","status":"Active"}

    {
  "id": "string",
  "avatarUrl": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "loginName": "string",
  "showName": "string",
  "phoneNumber": "string",
  "groups": [
    {
      "code": "string",
      "name": "string"
    }
  ],
  "roles": [
    {
      "code": "string",
      "name": "string",
      "fromGroup": {
        "groupCode": "string",
        "groupName": "string"
      }
    }
  ],
  "permissions": [
    "string"
  ],
  "storages": [
    {
      "poolCode": "string",
      "description": "string",
      "dependsOnGroup": {},
      "dependsOnRole": {},
      "units": [
        {
          "unitCode": "string",
          "label": [
            "string"
          ],
          "files": 0,
          "size": 0,
          "used": 0,
          "roots": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "createTime": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  "status": "Active"
}

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success UserResponseModel
    404: UserNotFound Specified user doesn't exist None

    Delete user

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE /api/v2/system/user('{userId}') \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    DELETE /api/v2/system/user('{userId}') HTTP/1.1

Accept: text/plain


    
const headers = {
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')',
{
  method: 'DELETE',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

result = RestClient.delete '/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

r = requests.delete('/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')', headers = headers)

print(r.json())


    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('DELETE','/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("DELETE");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("DELETE", "/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /api/v2/system/user('{userId}')

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    userId path string true User's ID

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {"id":"string","loginName":"string","showName":"string"}

    {
  "id": "string",
  "loginName": "string",
  "showName": "string"
}

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success UserDeletionResponseModel
    400: ValidationFailed Invalid request body None
    400: DeleteUserFailed The user can't be deleted whos still owns material(s), to continue please clean up those material first None

    Get user basic information by login name

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET /api/v2/system/login-name('{loginName}') \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    GET /api/v2/system/login-name('{loginName}') HTTP/1.1

Accept: text/plain


    
const headers = {
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/system/login-name('{loginName}')',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'

  'Accept' => 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

  'Accept': 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('GET','/api/v2/system/login-name('{loginName}')', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/login-name('{loginName}')");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "/api/v2/system/login-name('{loginName}')", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /api/v2/system/login-name('{loginName}')

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    loginName path string true User's login name

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {"id":"string","avatarUrl":"string","email":"string","loginName":"string","showName":"string","phoneNumber":"string","groups":[{"code":"string","name":"string"}],"roles":[{"code":"string","name":"string","fromGroup":{"groupCode":"string","groupName":"string"}}],"permissions":["string"],"storages":[{"poolCode":"string","description":"string","dependsOnGroup":{},"dependsOnRole":{},"units":[{"unitCode":"string","label":["string"],"files":0,"size":0,"used":0,"roots":{"property1":"string","property2":"string"}}]}],"createTime":"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","status":"Active"}

    {
  "id": "string",
  "avatarUrl": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "loginName": "string",
  "showName": "string",
  "phoneNumber": "string",
  "groups": [
    {
      "code": "string",
      "name": "string"
    }
  ],
  "roles": [
    {
      "code": "string",
      "name": "string",
      "fromGroup": {
        "groupCode": "string",
        "groupName": "string"
      }
    }
  ],
  "permissions": [
    "string"
  ],
  "storages": [
    {
      "poolCode": "string",
      "description": "string",
      "dependsOnGroup": {},
      "dependsOnRole": {},
      "units": [
        {
          "unitCode": "string",
          "label": [
            "string"
          ],
          "files": 0,
          "size": 0,
          "used": 0,
          "roots": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "createTime": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  "status": "Active"
}

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success UserResponseModel
    403: NoPermission Operation is forbidden due to admin role is missing None
    404: UserNotFound Specified user doesn't exist None

    Create user

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST /api/v2/system/user \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json-patch+json' \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    POST /api/v2/system/user HTTP/1.1

Content-Type: application/json-patch+json
Accept: text/plain


    const inputBody = '{
  "loginName": "string",
  "showName": "string",
  "password": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "phoneNumber": "string",
  "groupCodes": [
    "string"
  ],
  "roleCodes": [
    "string"
  ],
  "avatarUrl": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/system/user',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept' => 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

result = RestClient.post '/api/v2/system/user',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept': 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

r = requests.post('/api/v2/system/user', headers = headers)

print(r.json())


    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('POST','/api/v2/system/user', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/user");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json-patch+json"},
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "/api/v2/system/user", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /api/v2/system/user

    Body parameter

    {
  "loginName": "string",
  "showName": "string",
  "password": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "phoneNumber": "string",
  "groupCodes": [
    "string"
  ],
  "roleCodes": [
    "string"
  ],
  "avatarUrl": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    body body UserCreationModel true The user object
    loginName body string true Login name for authentication, it does not allow other special symbols except the "_"
    showName body string true User's display name
    password body string true Passowrd
    email body string false User's email
    phoneNumber body string false User's phone number
    groupCodes body [string] false Assign one or more groups to the user
    roleCodes body [string] false Assign one or more roles to the user
    avatarUrl body string false User's avatar, image url

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {"id":"string","avatarUrl":"string","email":"string","loginName":"string","showName":"string","phoneNumber":"string","groups":[{"code":"string","name":"string"}],"roles":[{"code":"string","name":"string","fromGroup":{"groupCode":"string","groupName":"string"}}],"permissions":["string"],"storages":[{"poolCode":"string","description":"string","dependsOnGroup":{},"dependsOnRole":{},"units":[{"unitCode":"string","label":["string"],"files":0,"size":0,"used":0,"roots":{"property1":"string","property2":"string"}}]}],"createTime":"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","status":"Active"}

    {
  "id": "string",
  "avatarUrl": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "loginName": "string",
  "showName": "string",
  "phoneNumber": "string",
  "groups": [
    {
      "code": "string",
      "name": "string"
    }
  ],
  "roles": [
    {
      "code": "string",
      "name": "string",
      "fromGroup": {
        "groupCode": "string",
        "groupName": "string"
      }
    }
  ],
  "permissions": [
    "string"
  ],
  "storages": [
    {
      "poolCode": "string",
      "description": "string",
      "dependsOnGroup": {},
      "dependsOnRole": {},
      "units": [
        {
          "unitCode": "string",
          "label": [
            "string"
          ],
          "files": 0,
          "size": 0,
          "used": 0,
          "roots": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "createTime": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  "status": "Active"
}

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success UserResponseModel
    400: ValidationFailed Invalid request body None
    403: NoPermission Operation is forbidden due to admin role is missing None
    404: GroupNotFound Specified group doesn't exist None
    409: DuplicateLoginName The requested login name exists, please try another login name None

    Modify the user's basic information

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT /api/v2/system/user \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json-patch+json' \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    PUT /api/v2/system/user HTTP/1.1

Content-Type: application/json-patch+json
Accept: text/plain


    const inputBody = '{
  "id": "string",
  "showName": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "phoneNumber": "string",
  "avatarUrl": "string",
  "status": "Active"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/system/user',
{
  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept' => 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

result = RestClient.put '/api/v2/system/user',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept': 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

r = requests.put('/api/v2/system/user', headers = headers)

print(r.json())


    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('PUT','/api/v2/system/user', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/user");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("PUT");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json-patch+json"},
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "/api/v2/system/user", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /api/v2/system/user

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "showName": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "phoneNumber": "string",
  "avatarUrl": "string",
  "status": "Active"
}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    body body UserModificationModel true The user object
    id body string true User's ID
    showName body string false User's display name
    email body string false User's email
    phoneNumber body string false User's contact phone number
    avatarUrl body string false User's avatar
    status body UserStatus false User's status

    Enumerated Values

    Parameter Value
    status Active
    status Disabled

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {"id":"string","avatarUrl":"string","email":"string","loginName":"string","showName":"string","phoneNumber":"string","groups":[{"code":"string","name":"string"}],"roles":[{"code":"string","name":"string","fromGroup":{"groupCode":"string","groupName":"string"}}],"permissions":["string"],"storages":[{"poolCode":"string","description":"string","dependsOnGroup":{},"dependsOnRole":{},"units":[{"unitCode":"string","label":["string"],"files":0,"size":0,"used":0,"roots":{"property1":"string","property2":"string"}}]}],"createTime":"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","status":"Active"}

    {
  "id": "string",
  "avatarUrl": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "loginName": "string",
  "showName": "string",
  "phoneNumber": "string",
  "groups": [
    {
      "code": "string",
      "name": "string"
    }
  ],
  "roles": [
    {
      "code": "string",
      "name": "string",
      "fromGroup": {
        "groupCode": "string",
        "groupName": "string"
      }
    }
  ],
  "permissions": [
    "string"
  ],
  "storages": [
    {
      "poolCode": "string",
      "description": "string",
      "dependsOnGroup": {},
      "dependsOnRole": {},
      "units": [
        {
          "unitCode": "string",
          "label": [
            "string"
          ],
          "files": 0,
          "size": 0,
          "used": 0,
          "roots": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "createTime": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  "status": "Active"
}

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success UserResponseModel
    400: ValidationFailed Invalid request body None

    Get all of parameters which are profiled by user

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET /api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameters \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    GET /api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameters HTTP/1.1

Accept: text/plain


    
const headers = {
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameters',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

result = RestClient.get '/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameters',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

r = requests.get('/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameters', headers = headers)

print(r.json())


    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('GET','/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameters', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameters");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameters", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameters

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    userId path string true User's ID

    Example responses

    200 Response

    [{"key":"string","value":"string","default":"string","description":"string"}]

    [
  {
    "key": "string",
    "value": "string",
    "default": "string",
    "description": "string"
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success Inline
    404: UserNotFound Specified user doesn't exist None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Restrictions Description
    anonymous [ParameterResponseModel] false none [Response object for parameter]
    key string false none Parameter key
    value string false none Parameter value
    default string false none Default parameter value, readonly
    description string false none Parameter description

    Modify an user's parameter

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT /api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameter \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json-patch+json' \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    PUT /api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameter HTTP/1.1

Content-Type: application/json-patch+json
Accept: text/plain


    const inputBody = '{
  "key": "string",
  "value": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameter',
{
  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept' => 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

result = RestClient.put '/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameter',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept': 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

r = requests.put('/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameter', headers = headers)

print(r.json())


    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('PUT','/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameter', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameter");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("PUT");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json-patch+json"},
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "/api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameter", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /api/v2/system/user('{userId}')/parameter

    Body parameter

    {
  "key": "string",
  "value": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    userId path string true User's ID
    body body ParameterModificationModel true The parameter object
    key body string true Parameter key
    value body string true Parameter value

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {"key":"string","value":"string","default":"string","description":"string"}

    {
  "key": "string",
  "value": "string",
  "default": "string",
  "description": "string"
}

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success ParameterResponseModel
    400: ValidationFailed Invalid request body None
    400: InvalidParameterKey The parameter key does not exist None

    Get the root group

  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'

  headers: headers

    return res.json();

    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.

try {
    $response = $client->request('GET','/api/v2/system/group/root', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/group/root");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /api/v2/system/group('{code}')

    Name In Type Required Description

  "code": "string",
  "parentCode": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",

    "string"
  ]

  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

{
  method: 'DELETE',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.

try {
    $response = $client->request('DELETE','/api/v2/system/group('{code}')', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("DELETE", "/api/v2/system/group('{code}')", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /api/v2/system/group('{code}')

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    code path string true The group's code

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {"code":"string","parentCode":"string","name":"string","description":"string","permissions":["string"]}

    {
  "code": "string",
  "parentCode": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "permissions": [
    "string"
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success GroupResponseModel
    400: ValidationFailed Invalid request body None
    400: RemoveGroupFailed Unable to remove the group which still contains sub-groups or sub-users, please clean up first None
    400: RemoveGroupFailed+Storage Unable to remove the group which still allocates storage space, please clean up first. None
    404: GroupNotFound Specified group doesn't exist None

    Get all users by specified group

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET /api/v2/system/group('{code}')/users \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'

Accept: text/plain

  'Accept':'text/plain',

};

{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "/api/v2/system/group('{code}')/users", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /api/v2/system/group('{code}')/users

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    code path string true Group's code

    Example responses

    200 Response

    [{"id":"string","avatarUrl":"string","email":"string","loginName":"string","showName":"string","phoneNumber":"string","createTime":"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","status":"Active"}]

    [
  {
    "id": "string",
    "avatarUrl": "string",
    "email": "string",
    "loginName": "string",
    "showName": "string",
    "phoneNumber": "string",
    "createTime": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
    "status": "Active"
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success Inline
    404: GroupNotFound Specified group doesn't exist None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Restrictions Description
    anonymous [UserSimpleResponseModel] false none [Response simple object for user]
    id string false none User's ID
    avatarUrl string false none An URL of the user's avatar
    email string false none Email
    loginName string false none User's login ID, it's unique and case-insensitive
    showName string false none User's name for display
    phoneNumber string false none User's contact number
    createTime string(date-time) false none User creation time
    status UserStatus false none User's status

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    status Active
    status Disabled

    Get all sub-groups by specified group

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET /api/v2/system/group('{code}')/subgroups \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    GET /api/v2/system/group('{code}')/subgroups HTTP/1.1

Accept: text/plain


    
const headers = {
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/system/group('{code}')/subgroups',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

result = RestClient.get '/api/v2/system/group('{code}')/subgroups',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

r = requests.get('/api/v2/system/group('{code}')/subgroups', headers = headers)

print(r.json())


    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('GET','/api/v2/system/group('{code}')/subgroups', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/group('{code}')/subgroups");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "/api/v2/system/group('{code}')/subgroups", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /api/v2/system/group('{code}')/subgroups

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    code path string true Group's code

    Example responses

    200 Response

    [{"code":"string","parentCode":"string","name":"string","description":"string","permissions":["string"]}]

    [
  {
    "code": "string",
    "parentCode": "string",
    "name": "string",
    "description": "string",
    "permissions": [
      "string"
    ]
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success Inline
    404: GroupNotFound Specified group doesn't exist None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Restrictions Description
    anonymous [GroupResponseModel] false none [Response object for Hive group]
    code string false none Group's code
    parentCode string false none Group's parent code
    name string false none Group's name
    description string false none Group's description
    permissions [string] false none The assigned permissions of the group

    Create group

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST /api/v2/system/group \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json-patch+json' \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    POST /api/v2/system/group HTTP/1.1

Content-Type: application/json-patch+json
Accept: text/plain


    const inputBody = '{
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "parentCode": "string",
  "permissions": [
    "string"
  ]
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/system/group',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept' => 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

result = RestClient.post '/api/v2/system/group',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept': 'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

r = requests.post('/api/v2/system/group', headers = headers)

print(r.json())


    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('POST','/api/v2/system/group', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/group");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json-patch+json"},
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "/api/v2/system/group", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /api/v2/system/group

    Body parameter

    {
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "parentCode": "string",
  "permissions": [
    "string"
  ]
}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    body body GroupCreationModel true The group object
    name body string true Group's name
    description body string false Group's description
    parentCode body string true The parent code of the group
    permissions body [string] false Assign permissions to the group

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {"code":"string","parentCode":"string","name":"string","description":"string","permissions":["string"]}

    {
  "code": "string",
  "parentCode": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "permissions": [
    "string"
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success GroupResponseModel
    400: ValidationFailed Invalid request body None
    404: ParentGroupNotFound Specified parent group doesn't exist None
    400: InvalidPermissionCode Invalid permission code None
    400: DuplicateGroup Unable to create duplicate group in the same group None

    Modify group

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT /api/v2/system/group \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json-patch+json' \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    PUT /api/v2/system/group HTTP/1.1

Content-Type: application/json-patch+json
Accept: text/plain


    const inputBody = '{
  "code": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "parentCode": "string",
  "permissions": [
    "string"
  ]
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json-patch+json',
  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/system/group',
{
  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

  'Content-Type': 'application/json-patch+json',

    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Content-Type' => 'application/json-patch+json',
    'Accept' => 'text/plain',
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('PUT','/api/v2/system/group', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/group");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("PUT");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json-patch+json"},
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "/api/v2/system/group", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /api/v2/system/group

    Body parameter

    {
  "code": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "parentCode": "string",
  "permissions": [
    "string"
  ]
}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    body body GroupModificationModel true The group object
    code body string true Group's code
    name body string false Group's name
    description body string false Group's description
    parentCode body string false Modify the group's parent code to move the position of the group
    permissions body [string] false Update permissions to the group

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {"code":"string","parentCode":"string","name":"string","description":"string","permissions":["string"]}

    {
  "code": "string",
  "parentCode": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "permissions": [
    "string"
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success GroupResponseModel
    400: ValidationFailed Invalid request body None
    400: MoveGroupFailed Unable to move the group which still contains sub-groups or sub-users, please clean up first None
    400: InvalidPermissionCode Invalid permission code None
    400: DuplicateGroup Unable to create duplicate group in the same group None
    404: GroupNotFound Specified group doesn't exist None

    Assign an user to group

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT /api/v2/system/group('{groupCode}')/user('{userId}') \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    PUT /api/v2/system/group('{groupCode}')/user('{userId}') HTTP/1.1


    
const headers = {
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/system/group('{groupCode}')/user('{userId}')',
{
  method: 'PUT',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)

  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'

    <?php

    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',

    $response = $client->request('PUT','/api/v2/system/group('{groupCode}')/user('{userId}')', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/group('{groupCode}')/user('{userId}')");

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "/api/v2/system/group('{groupCode}')/user('{userId}')", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /api/v2/system/group('{groupCode}')/user('{userId}')

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    groupCode path string true Group's code
    userId path string true User's ID

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success None
    404: UserNotFound Specified user doesn't exist None
    404: GroupNotFound Specified group doesn't exist None

    Remove an user from group

  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'


    DELETE /api/v2/system/group('{groupCode}')/user('{userId}') HTTP/1.1


    
const headers = {
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

fetch('/api/v2/system/group('{groupCode}')/user('{userId}')',
{
  method: 'DELETE',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

  'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY'
}

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

  'Basic Authorization': 'API_KEY'
}

    <?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

$headers = array(
    'Basic Authorization' => 'API_KEY',
);

$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

// Define array of request body.
$request_body = array();

try {
    $response = $client->request('DELETE','/api/v2/system/group('{groupCode}')/user('{userId}')', array(
        'headers' => $headers,
        'json' => $request_body,
       )
    );
    print_r($response->getBody()->getContents());
 }
 catch (\GuzzleHttp\Exception\BadResponseException $e) {
    // handle exception or api errors.
    print_r($e->getMessage());
 }

 // ...


    URL obj = new URL("/api/v2/system/group('{groupCode}')/user('{userId}')");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("DELETE");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());

        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /api/v2/system/group('{groupCode}')/user('{userId}')

    Parameters

    userId path string true User's ID

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},
        "Basic Authorization": []string{"API_KEY"},
    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "/api/v2/system/roles", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /api/v2/system/roles

    Example responses

    200 Response

    [{"code":"string","name":"string","description":"string","permissions":[{"key":"string","description":"string"}]}]

    [
  {
    "code": "string",
    "name": "string",
    "description": "string",
    "permissions": [
      {
        "key": "string",
        "description": "string"
      }
    ]
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Description Schema
    200 Success Inline

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Restrictions Description
    anonymous [RoleResponseModel] false none [Response object for Hive role]
    code string false none Role's code
    name string false none Role's name for display
    description string false none Role's description
    permissions [PermissionResponseModel] false none The assigned permissions of the role
    key string false none Permission key
    description string false none Permission description

    Get all users by specified role

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET /api/v2/system/role('{code}')/users \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain' \
  -H 'Basic Authorization: API_KEY'

Accept: text/plain

  'Accept':'text/plain',
  'Basic Authorization':'API_KEY'
};

{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
